abstract.text: A dictionary that contains the compression settings for the output.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: To receive samples in their device-native format, set this value to an empty dictionary:

code: myVideoOutput.videoSettings = [:] // Receive samples in device format.
myVideoOutput.videoSettings = @{ }; // Receive samples in device format.

inlineContent.text: To receive samples in a default uncompressed format, set this value to
. Then you can query this value to receive a dictionary of the settings the session uses.
In iOS versions prior to iOS 16, the only key supported is
. In iOS 16 and later, the supported keys include the following:

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that represents a connection from a capture input to a capture output.
An orientation that tells the connection how to rotate a video flowing through it.
The capture format in use by the device.
A capture output that records video and provides access to video frames for processing.
Indicates whether to drop video frames if they arrive late.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the output automatically configures the size of output buffers.
The video codecs that the output supports.
The video pixel formats the output supports.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the output is configured to deliver preview-sized buffers.
The minimum frame duration.
Returns a video settings dictionary appropriate for capturing video to a file with the specified codec and type.
Returns a dictionary of recommended output settings for writing the specified code, file type, and output URL.
Specifies the recommended settings for use with an AVAssetWriterInput.
A dictionary that contains the compression settings for the output.
The key for a dictionary that indicates whether the client can process wide color.
A key that defines the region within the video dimension displayed during playback.
The key for a dictionary that contains properties specifying video color.
A key to access the video’s pixel aspect ratio.
A key to retrieve the video scaling mode from a dictionary.
Configure video processing settings using standard key and value constants.
A key to the height of the pixel buffer.
A key to one or more pixel buffer format types.
A key to the width of the pixel buffer.
Name of an exception that occurs when you pass an invalid argument to a method, such as a `nil` pointer where a non-`nil` object is required.
A true value.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
